mapper.sql: a.id AS "id", a.user_id AS "user.id", a.article_id AS "article.id", m.title AS "article.title", a.difficulty_degree AS "difficultyDegree", a.help_degree AS "helpDegree", a.create_by AS "createBy.id", a.create_date AS "createDate", a.update_by AS "updateBy.id", a.update_date AS "updateDate", a.learn_minutes AS "learnMinutes", a.remarks AS "remarks", a.del_flag AS "delFlag", u2.name AS "user.name", u1.name AS "createBy.name", u3.name AS "updateBy.name"

LEFT JOIN sys_user u2 ON u2.id = a.user_id JOIN sys_user u ON u.id = a.user_id LEFT JOIN sys_user u1 ON u1.id=a.create_by LEFT JOIN sys_user u3 ON u3.id=a.update_by JOIN cms_article m ON m.id = a.article_id
mapper.insert: INSERT INTO cms_learn_records( id, user_id, article_id, difficulty_degree, help_degree, create_by, create_date, update_by, update_date, learn_minutes, remarks, del_flag ) VALUES ( #{id}, #{user.id}, #{article.id}, #{difficultyDegree}, #{helpDegree}, #{createBy.id}, #{createDate}, #{updateBy.id}, #{updateDate}, #{learnMinutes}, #{remarks}, #{delFlag} )
mapper.update: UPDATE cms_learn_records SET user_id = #{user.id}, article_id = #{article.id}, difficulty_degree = #{difficultyDegree}, help_degree = #{helpDegree}, update_by = #{updateBy.id}, update_date = #{updateDate}, learn_minutes = #{learnMinutes}, remarks = #{remarks} WHERE id = #{id}
